thread.title: Injured Max Scherzer may not be ready for start of Nationals season
thread.title_full: Injured Max Scherzer may not be ready for start of Nationals season

title: Injured Max Scherzer may not be ready for start of Nationals season
text:
Injured Max Scherzer may not be ready for start of Nationals season USA TODAY Sports Feb 16, 2017 at 3:51p ET 0Shares 
There is growing concern at Washington Nationals camp that their ace Max Scherzer may not be ready for the start of the regular season. 
The right-hander was diagnosed with what the club called a “stress fracture in the knuckle of his right ring finger” in December. "I’ve dealt with aches and pains and strains and sprains, but this is a whole different ballgame."– Max Scherzer https://t.co/5bO5sIctn4 
— Max Scherzer (@Max_Scherzer) January 9, 2017 
But at Nationals camp in West Palm Beach, Fla., on Thursday, Scherzer told reporters that he was unsure he would be ready for the start of the season. Max Scherzer would not commit to being ready for opening day. Knuckle is healed, but still has symptoms. Played catch today. 
— Chelsea Janes (@chelsea_janes) February 16, 2017 
Manager Dusty Baker is thinking of alternative plans in case Scherzer isn’t ready. Dusty said Nats have to make plans in case Scherzer isn't ready to start the season, but that they just don't know yet. 
— Chelsea Janes (@chelsea_janes) February 16, 2017 Dusty made two obvious but important points re Max: 1) better knuckle than elbow/shoulder. 2) fewer innings early means more strength late. 
— Chelsea Janes (@chelsea_janes) February 16, 2017 
Scherzer, the 2016 National League Cy Young winner, was 20-7 with a 2.96 ERA in 228-plus innings in 2016. He struck out 284 batters, including a spectacular 20-strikeout performance against the Detroit Tigers on May 11. 
There was some good news at Nationals camp as Stephen Straburg looked ready to return after an injury-marred 2016 campaign. Stephen Strasburg is throwing off a mound. Seems unrestricted. pic.twitter.com/zoR8eKn5IA
